title: Certain propositions by which the doctrin of the H. Trinity is so explain'd, according to the ancient fathers, as to speak it not contradictory to natural reason together with a defence of them, in answer to the objections of a Socianian writer, in his newly printed Considerations on the explications of the doctrin of the Trinity : occasioned by these propositions among other discourses : in a letter to that author.
author: Fowler, Edward, 1632-1714.
notes: Attributed to Edward Fowler. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.).
A reissue of: Twenty-eight propositions by which the doctrine of the Trinity is endeavoured to be explained. 1693. Cf. DNB.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
